Q. 1.question: Given the following state transition table Which of the test cases below will cover the following series of state transitions? S1 SO S1 S2 SO

Q. 2.question: From a Testing perspective, what are the MAIN purposes of Configuration Management?
details: i) Identifying the version of software under test.
ii) Controlling the version of testware items.
iv) Tracking changes to testware items.
v) Analysing the need for new testware items.

Q. 3.question: Which of the following is a MAJOR task of test planning?

options.A: Scheduling test analysis and design tasks.

Q. 4.question: Which of the following BEST describes the difference between an inspection and a walkthrough?

options.A: Both inspections and walkthroughs are led by the author.
options.B: An inspection is led by a moderator and a walkthrough is led by the author.
options.C: Both inspections and walkthroughs are led by a trained moderator.
options.D: A walkthrough is led by the author. The author is not present during inspections.

Q. 5.question: Where may functional testing be performed?

options.A: At system and acceptance testing levels only.
options.C: At all levels above integration testing.
options.D: At the acceptance testing level only.

Q. 6.question: What is the MAIN objective when reviewing a software deliverable?

options.A: To identify potential application failures by use of a test specification.
options.B: To identify defects in any software work product.
options.C: To identify spelling mistakes in a requirements specification.
options.D: To identify standards inconsistencies in the code.

Q. 7.question: Who would USUALLY perform debugging activities?

Q. 8.question: Which of the following would you NOT usually find on a software incident report?

options.A: The name and/or organisational position of the person raising the problem.
options.B: Version of the Software Under Test.
options.C: Suggestions as to how to fix the problem.

Q. 9.question: Which of the following defines the expected results of a test?

Q. 10.question: Some tools are geared more for developer use. For the 5 tools listed, which statement BEST details those for developers?

options.A: i, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
options.B: ii , and iv. are more for developers.
options.C: ii, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
options.D: ii. and iii. are more for developers.

Q. 11.question: Which of the following is correct?

options.A: Impact analysis assesses the effect on the system of a defect found in regression testing.
options.B: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a new person joining the regression test team.
options.C: Impact analysis assesses whether or not a defect found in regression testing has been fixed correctly.
options.D: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a change to the system to determine how much regression testing to do.

Q. 12.question: As part of which test process do you determine the exit criteria?

Q. 13.question: Given the following state transition diagram Which of the following series of state transitions contains an INVALID transition which may indicate a fault in the system design?

options.A: Login Browse Basket Checkout Basket Checkout Pay Logout.
options.B: Login Browse Basket Checkout Pay Logout.
options.C: Login Browse Basket Checkout Basket Logout.
options.D: Login Browse Basket Browse Basket Checkout Pay Logout.

Q. 14.question: Which of the following is a MAJOR task of test implementation and execution?

options.C: Identifying test conditions or test requirements.
options.D: Assessing if more tests are needed.

options.A: Testing performed by potential customers at the developers location.
options.B: Testing performed by potential customers at their own locations.
options.C: Testing performed by product developers at the customer's location.
options.D: Testing performed by product developers at their own locations.

Q. 16.question: Given the following fragment of code, how many tests are required for 100% decision coverage?

Q. 17.question: You have designed test cases to provide 100% statement and 100% decision coverage for the following fragment of code. if width > length then biggest_dimension = width else biggest_dimension = length end_if The following has been added to the bottom of the code fragment above. print "Biggest dimension is " & biggest_dimension print "Width: " & width print "Length: " & length How many more test cases are required?

options.A: One more test case will be required for 100 % decision coverage.
options.B: Two more test cases will be required for 100 % statement coverage, one of which will be used to provide 100% decision coverage.
options.C: None, existing test cases can be used.
options.D: One more test case will be required for 100% statement coverage.

Q. 18.question: A thermometer measures temperature in whole degrees only. If the temperature falls below 18 degrees, the heating is switched off. It is switched on again when the temperature reaches 21 degrees. What are the best values in degrees to cover all equivalence partitions?

Q. 19.question: Which activity in the fundamental test process creates test suites for efficient test execution?

Q. 20.question: Which of the following is TRUE?

options.A: Confirmation testing is testing fixes to a set of defects and Regression testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
options.B: Confirmation testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes and Regression testing is testing fixes to a set of defects.
options.C: Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
options.D: Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing fixes to a set of defects.

Q. 21.question: Given the following decision table: Which of the following test cases and expected results is VALID?

options.A: 23 year old in insurance class A Premium is 0 and excess is 500.
options.B: 51 year old in insurance class C Premium is 0 and excess is 00.
options.C: 31 year old in insurance class B Premium is 0 and excess is 500.
options.D: 43 year old in insurance class C Premium is 0 and excess is 000.

Q. 22.question: When should configuration management procedures be implemented?

Q. 23.question: Which of the following are characteristic of regression testing?
statements: i) Regression testing is run ONLY once
ii) Regression testing is used after fixes have been made
iii) Regression testing is often automated
iv) Regression tests need not be maintained

Q. 24.question: A wholesaler sells printer cartridges. The minimum order quantity is 5. There is a 20% discount for orders of 100 or more printer cartridges. You have been asked to prepare test cases using various values for the number of printer cartridges ordered. Which of the following groups contain three test inputs that would be generated using Boundary Value Analysis?

Q. 25.question: Which of the following activities should be performed during the selection and implementation of a testing tool?
statements: i) Investigate the organisation's test process.
ii) Conduct a proof of concept.
iii) Implement the selected tool on a project behind schedule to save time.
iv) Identify coaching and mentoring requirements for the use of the selected tool.

Q. 26.question: What is the MAIN benefit of designing tests early in the life cycle?

options.A: It is cheaper than designing tests during the test phases.
options.B: It helps prevent defects from being introduced into the code.
options.C: Tests designed early are more effective than tests designed later.
options.D: It saves time during the testing phases when testers are busy.

Q. 27.question: Which of the following benefits are MOST likely to be achieved by using test tools?
statements: i) Easy to access information about tests and testing.
iii) Easy and cheap to implement.

Q. 28.question: What is the KEY difference between preventative and reactive approaches to testing?

options.A: Preventative tests and reactive tests are designed as early as possible.
options.B: Preventative tests are designed early; reactive tests are designed after the software has been produced.
options.C: Preventative testing is always analytical; reactive testing is always heuristic.
options.D: Preventative tests are designed after the software has been produced; reactive tests are designed early in response to review comments.

Q. 29.question: What is the purpose of exit criteria?

options.A: To define when a test level is complete.
options.B: To determine when a test has completed.
options.C: To identify when a software system should be retired.
options.D: To determine whether a test has passed.

Q. 30.question: What determines the level of risk?

options.A: The cost of dealing with an adverse event if it occurs.
options.B: The probability that an adverse event will occur.
options.C: The amount of testing planned before release of a system.
options.D: The likelihood of an adverse event and the impact of the event.

Q. 31.question: With which of the following categories is a test comparator tool USUALLY associated?

options.A: Tool support for performance and monitoring.
options.C: Tool support for test execution and logging.
options.D: Tool support for the management of testing and tests.

Q. 32.question: Which activities form part of test planning?
details: ii) Defining the overall approach to testing.

options.A: i, ii & iv are true, iii & v are false.
options.B: ii & iii are true, i, iv & v are false.
options.C: iv & v are true, i, ii & iii are false.
options.D: i, ii & iii are true iv & v are false.

Q. 34.question: Which type of test design techniques does the following statement best describe a procedure to derive test cases based on the specification of a component?

Q. 35.question: For which of the following would a static analysis tool be MOST useful?

options.C: Testing code executed in a special test harness.

Q. 36.question: Which of the following types of defects is use case testing MOST LIKELY to uncover?
details: i) Defects in the process flows during real-world use of the system.
ii) Defects in the interface parameters in integration testing.
iii) Integration defects caused by the interaction and interference of different components.
iv) Defects in the system as it transitions between one state and another.

Q. 37.question: Which of the following is MOST important in the selection of a test approach?

options.A: Availability of tools to support the proposed techniques.
options.B: The budget allowed for training in proposed techniques.
options.C: Available skills and experience in the proposed techniques.
options.D: The willingness of the test team to learn new techniques.

Q. 38.question: Which of the following is a benefit of test independence?

options.A: It does not require familiarity with the code.
options.B: It is cheaper than using developers to test their own code.
options.C: It avoids author bias in defining effective tests.
options.D: Testers are better at finding defects than developers.

Q. 39.question: The above diagram represents the following paths through the code. What is the MINIMUM combination of paths required to provide full statement coverage?

Q. 40.question: Which of the following is MOST characteristic of specification based (black-box) techniques?

options.A: Test cases can be easily automated.
options.B: Test cases are independent of each other.
options.C: Test cases are derived systematically from models of the system.
options.D: Test cases are derived systematically from the delivered code.

Q. 41.question: Which of the following combinations correctly describes a valid approach to component testing?
details: v) Functional testing of the component in isolation.
w) Structure-based testing of the code without recording incidents.
x) Automated tests that are run until the component passes.
y) Functional testing of the interfaces between modules.

Q. 42.question: Which of the following is a purpose of the review planning phase?

options.B: Explain the documents to the participants.

options.A: Shows the number of newly discovered defects per unit time.
options.B: Shows the number of open defects per unit time.
options.C: Shows the cumulative total number of defects found up to this time.
options.D: Any of these, depending on the company.

Q. 44.question: Which is the best definition of complete testing?

options.A: You have discovered every bug in the program.
options.B: You have tested every statement, branch, and combination of branches in the program.
options.C: You have completed every test in the test plan.
options.D: You have reached the scheduled ship date.

Q. 45.question: Complete statement and branch coverage means:

options.A: That you have tested every statement in the program.
options.B: That you have tested every statement and every branch in the program.
options.C: That you have tested every IF statement in the program.
options.D: That you have tested every combination of values of IF statements in the program.

Q. 46.question: There are several risks of managing your project's schedule with a statistical reliability model. These include (choose one or more of the following):

options.A: Testers spend more energy early in the product trying to find bugs than preparing to do the rest of the project's work more efficiently.
options.B: Managers might not realize that the testing effort is ineffective, late in the project, because they expect a low rate of bug finding, so the low rate achieved doesn't alarm them.
options.C: It can increase the end-of-project pressure on testers to not find bugs, or to not report bugs.

Q. 47.question: Typical defects that are easier to find in reviews than in dynamic testing are:

options.D: Insufficient maintainability and incorrect interface specifications.

Q. 48.question: Reviews, static analysis and dynamic testing have the same objective

Q. 49.question: We can achieve complete statement coverage but still miss bugs because:

options.A: The failure occurs only if you reach a statement taking the TRUE branch of an IF statement, and you got to the statement with a test that passed through the FALSE branch.
options.B: The failure depends on the program's inability to handle specific data values, rather than on the program's flow of control.
options.C: We are not required to test code that customers are unlikely to execute.

Q. 50.question: Measurement dysfunction is a problem because:

options.A: Even though the numbers you look at appear better, to achieve these numbers , people are doing other aspects of their work much less well.
options.B: We don't know how to measure a variable (our measurement is dysfunctional) and so we don't know how to interpret the result.
options.C: You are measuring the wrong thing and thus reaching the wrong conclusions.

Q. 51.question: Important consequences of the impossibility of complete testing are (Choose one or more answers):

options.A: We can never be certain that the program is bug free.
options.B: We have no definite stopping point for testing, which makes it easier for some managers to argue for very little testing.
options.C: We have no easy answer for what testing tasks should always be required, because every task takes time that could be spent on other high importance tasks.

options.A: Non-functional requirements only not Functional requirements.
options.B: Functional requirements only not non-functional requirements.

options.D: Planning, Individual preparation, Follow up, Kick off.

options.B: Add more engineers to the project to make up for lost work.
options.C: Ask the current developers to work overtime until the lost work is recovered.

options.A: Confront the person and ask that other team members be allowed to express their opinions.
